alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 7:22PM MST until August 11 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... western Coconino County near Supai in Arizona... * Until 845 PM MST. * At 710 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain near Supai. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing. The Havasu Creek gauge at Supai crested with a 5 foot rise and continues to show elevated levels and flow. A flood wave still can impact Havasu Creek, Mooney Falls, Havasu Falls, Beaver Falls, and the Havasu Creek-Colorado River confluence. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Havasupai Reservation and Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Havasu Creek, Tapeats Creek, Royal Arch Creek, Deer Creek, Sowats Canyon, Shinumo Creek, Little Coyote Canyon, Jumpup Canyon, and the Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
